Tucson looks to the group and steps back.  He knew he couldn't escape, beca=
use he had a demon to slay, his own personal demon.  He had to be sure that=
 the Rodimus he was about to face was the one who needed a second chance to=
 rebound his true identity, and be freed of the shackles of enemy possessio=
n.  He shakes his head.

" You go, I must remain here.  Rodimus will need m=
e even though he thinks he doesn't.  The Matrix depends on my actions.  Whe=
n you reach the Ark, yell Leo Prime that I'm all right, and I am trying to =
recover Rodimus and the others who have vanished mysteriously.  Now, to mak=
e this look convincing.. "

He lies down on the ground, appearing to have b=
een stunned by someone.

" When the guards come around and see me like this=
, they will hopefully think that you did this against me and I will act lik=
e I have no recollection of you doing this.  Part of my neuro circuitry was=
 effected a while ago and I still have the scarring to prove it. "

He give=
s a wink of an eye and puts his head down on the ground, optics completely =
shut.

Perpetually on the move and constantly busy. 

On Oct 14, 2011, at 1=
2:24 PM, Super Cyclonus <supercyclonus@...> wrote:

> > <OLD>
> >
> >=
 Tucson needed to avoid falling into the same trap that Magmatron fell into=
.
> > He had been warned before about his temper and now was the true test =
of
> > control. He shakes his head to try and knock some sense into himself=
, which
> > he was finding very hard to do.
> >
> > " You're right Big Conv=
oy, I shouldn't be as aggressive as I am, I'm just
> > extremely frustrated=
 by the fact that I can't pull Rodimus out of corruption
> > as I hoped to =
the first time I rescued him. What I really need is guidance,
> > not viole=
nce. But in order to attempt another recovery, I will have to
> > fight him=
. I must knock whatever it is that's controlling him out of his
> > interna=
l programming. By some form of strong impact, I may be able to
> > jostle s=
omething loose to enable Rodimus to regain control of his own logic
> > cir=
cuitry. Then I have to get him to surrender the matrix for safe
> > keeping=
 until such time Rodimus is free of his invasive programming.. Thank
> > yo=
u for stopping me by the way, I'm glad you were honest with me."
> 
> <NEW>=

> 
> There was a nod from CONVOY, in the darkness it was just his optics
>=
 glowing brightly as he moved his head. "We all have lessons to learn,
> yo=
u are young yet."
> 
> There was a click on the floor and then a thunk and =
then light began
> to pour into the cell, it was coming from a hole int he =
floor that had
> not been there before.
> 
> "Who is this?" Said a figure s=
tanding in the hole, he was colored in
> various shades of blue, gray, red,=
 and yellow, and was slender yet
> seemingly agile.
> 
> BIG CONVOY sighed,=
 "Night Viper, meet Tuscon." BIG gestured between
> TUSCON and this new com=
er, "And Tuscon, this is our resident escape
> artist Night Viper."
> 
> "S=
lag!" NIGHT VIPER said as he glanced at TUSCON, "We don't have time
> for t=
his." He was obviously talking to BIG CONVOY and annoyed at
> having TUSCON=
 there.
> 
> BIG glanced at NIGHT VIPER, "I'll vouch for him." He said, his=
 deep
> voice quiet as a whisper.
> 
> There was a nod from NIGHT VIPER as =
he looked at TUSCON, "Well come on
> then, this way!" He disappeared back t=
hrough the hole, a hole just big
> enough for the likes of BIG CONVOY and T=
USCON to fit through. "And
> watch your step." He added.
> 
> (TAG)
> 
> Pr=
eston
>

<html><body bgcolor=3D"#FFFFFF"><div>Tucson looks to the group and steps ba=
ck.  He knew he couldn't escape, because he had a demon to slay, his o=
wn personal demon.  He had to be sure that the Rodimus he was about to=
 face was the one who needed a second chance to rebound his true identity, =
and be freed of the shackles of enemy possession.  He shakes his head.=
</div><div><br></div><div>" You go, I must remain here.  Rodimus will =
need me even though he thinks he doesn't.  The Matrix depends on my ac=
tions.  When you reach the Ark, yell Leo Prime that I'm all right, and=
 I am trying to recover Rodimus and the others who have vanished mysterious=
ly.  Now, to make this look convincing.. "</div><div><br></div><div>He=
 lies down on the ground, appearing to have been stunned by someone.</div><=
div><br></div><div>" When the guards come around and see me like this, they=
 will hopefully think that you did this against me and I will act like I ha=
ve no recollection of you doing this.  Part of my neuro circuitry was =
effected a while ago and I still have the scarring to prove it. "</div><div=
><br></div><div>He gives a wink of an eye and puts his head down on the gro=
und, optics completely shut.</div><div><br>Perpetually on the move and cons=
tantly busy. </div><div><br>On Oct 14, 2011, at 12:24 PM, Super Cyclon=
us <<a href=3D"mailto:supercyclonus@...">supercyclonus@...</=
a>> wrote:<br><br></div><div></div><blockquote type=3D"cite"><div>

    <div id=3D"ygrp-text">

      <p>> <OLD><br>
><br>
> Tucson needed to avo=
id falling into the same trap that Magmatron fell into.<br>
> He had bee=
n warned before about his temper and now was the true test of<br>
> cont=
rol.  He shakes his head to try and knock some sense into himself, which<br=
>
> he was finding very hard to do.<br>
><br>
> " You're right Big=
 Convoy, I shouldn't be as aggressive as I am, I'm just<br>
> extremely =
frustrated by the fact that I can't pull Rodimus out of corruption<br>
>=
 as I hoped to the first time I rescued him.  What I really need is guidanc=
e,<br>
> not violence.  But in order to attempt another recovery, I will=
 have to<br>
> fight him. I must knock whatever it is that's controlling=
 him out of his<br>
> internal programming.  By some form of strong impa=
ct, I may be able to<br>
> jostle something loose to enable Rodimus to r=
egain control of his own logic<br>
> circuitry.     Then I have to get h=
im to surrender the matrix for safe<br>
> keeping until such time Rodimu=
s is free of his invasive programming..  Thank<br>
> you for stopping me=
 by the way, I'm glad you were honest with me."<br>
<br>
<NEW><br>
<b=
r>
There was a nod from CONVOY, in the darkness it was just his optics<br>
=
glowing brightly as he moved his head. "We all have lessons to learn,<br>
y=
ou are young yet."<br>
<br>
There was a click on the floor and then a thunk=
 and then light began<br>
to pour into the cell, it was coming from a hole =
int he floor that had<br>
not been there before.<br>
<br>
"Who is this?" Sa=
id a figure standing in the hole, he was colored in<br>
various shades of b=
lue, gray, red, and yellow, and was slender yet<br>
seemingly agile.<br>
<b=
r>
BIG CONVOY sighed, "Night Viper, meet Tuscon." BIG gestured between<br>
=
TUSCON and this new comer, "And Tuscon, this is our resident escape<br>
art=
ist Night Viper."<br>
<br>
"Slag!" NIGHT VIPER said as he glanced at TUSCON=
, "We don't have time<br>
for this." He was obviously talking to BIG CONVOY=
 and annoyed at<br>
having TUSCON there.<br>
<br>
BIG glanced at NIGHT VIPE=
R, "I'll vouch for him." He said, his deep<br>
voice quiet as a whisper.<br=
>
<br>
There was a nod from NIGHT VIPER as he looked at TUSCON, "Well come =
on<br>
then, this way!" He disappeared back through the hole, a hole just b=
ig<br>
enough for the likes of BIG CONVOY and TUSCON to fit through. "And<b=
r>
watch your step." He added.<br>
<br>
(TAG)<br>
<br>
Preston<br>
